intro: Mesembryanthemum glaciale, commonly known as the snowflake flower, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves and showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, featuring a compact growth form and a nocturnal blooming habit. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, open in response to cool temperatures and morning dew. Mesembryanthemum glaciale is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its unique appearance and resilience in dry conditions.
